message.content:
To extract a three-character code like "1Jn" from a filename in the format "57-1Jn.usfm", we can use the following regex expression:

`(\d{1,2}|[A-Za-z]+)(?=\-\d\.\w+$)`

Explanation of the regex expression:

- `(\d{1,2}|[A-Za-z]+)` - This part matches either a one or two digit number (`\d{1,2}`) or any combination of upper and lower case letters (`[A-Za-z]+`). The parentheses are used to capture the matched three characters.
- `(?=\-\d\.\w+$)` - This part is a positive lookahead that checks for the following conditions:
  - A hyphen (`\-`) must be present after the captured code.
  - One or more digits (`\d`) must follow the hyphen.
  - A dot (`.`) must be present after the digits.
  - One or more alphanumeric characters (`\w+`) must be present after the dot to match the file extension ".usfm". The `$` denotes the end of the string.

You can use this regex expression in your programming language of choice to extract the three-character code from filenames following the mentioned format.
